intro: Chaetanthera serrata var. humilis, commonly known as the dwarf chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its slender, branched stems and finely serrated leaves contribute to its distinctive appearance. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
